Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for the web application, including hosting needs, supported frameworks, and integration with APIs or backend services.
Plan the architecture of the web application, including static content hosting, API integration, and CI/CD workflows.
Ensure an active Azure subscription is available and assign necessary permissions for the team to deploy and manage resources.

Tasks.Task: Create Azure Static Web App Resource
Tasks.Task Description: Provision a new Azure Static Web App resource in the Azure portal, specifying the repository and branch for deployment.
Link the Azure Static Web App to a GitHub or Azure DevOps repository for automated deployments.
Configure a CI/CD pipeline to automate the build and deployment process using GitHub Actions or Azure DevOps.
Enable security features such as custom authentication providers, role-based access control, and HTTPS enforcement.
Set up a custom domain for the web application and configure DNS settings to point to the Azure Static Web App.
Verify the deployment of the web application, including functionality, performance, and integration with APIs.
Configure monitoring and alerting for the web application using Azure Monitor and Application Insights.
Create detailed documentation for the application setup, including architecture, deployment process, and troubleshooting steps.
Provide training to the operations team on managing and maintaining the Azure Static Web App.
Conduct periodic audits to ensure compliance with security and performance standards.
Use Azure Monitor and Application Insights to continuously track the performance of the Static Web App, including response times, error rates, and user interactions.
Regularly review and update the dependencies used in the Static Web App to ensure compatibility, security, and performance improvements.
Conduct security audits to identify vulnerabilities in the Static Web App, including reviewing authentication mechanisms and access controls.
Ensure regular backups of the Static Web App configuration, including routing rules, authentication settings, and environment variables.
Verify the functionality of the CI/CD pipeline used for deploying the Static Web App to ensure smooth and error-free deployments.
Analyze performance metrics and implement optimizations, such as reducing asset sizes, enabling caching, and improving load times.
Regularly test authentication and authorization mechanisms to ensure secure access to the Static Web App.
Perform failover tests to ensure the Static Web App can recover from outages or disruptions without data loss or service downtime.
Review and update environment variables used in the Static Web App to ensure they are correctly configured and secure.
Collect and analyze user feedback to identify areas for improvement in the Static Web App's functionality and user experience.
Evaluate the SLA performance of Azure Static Web Apps to ensure compliance with uptime and performance guarantees.
